Posts.Content: Vicky9989 wrote: Good evening, I've been lingering for a few days and I really need to talk to someone. I'm 27 and have only really started to examine my breasts properly this last month or two. Well I found what feels like a pea sized lump on my left breast, went to the doctors and originally she wanted to wait to see if it disappeared after my period in 2 weeks but I went back today as noticed my nipple sinks in a little bit when laying down and I now have a scan next week. I have totally convinced myself I have it and I won't have long left. The only reassurance I am taking is that it seems to move around quite easy. I have no history of breast cancer in my family but I am worrying myself sick, I can't focus on anything else and I'm finding it hard to carry on with life, just constantly sitting on my phone googling I have two young daughters and I'm so so scared. Is anyone in the same position at the moment waiting for tests?? Petrified Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Vicky9989 wrote: Hi I'm 28 from the uk. Last month I found a small bean shaped lump in my outer upper side of my left breast, it was moveable and after prodding it was a little tender. I went for a ultarascan and they straight away said it was a lymphanode (in fact there was 2 but hadn't felt the other one) she said it was a normal size, not suspicious and that was that. Well this month (about 3 weeks after ultrasound) just before my period I noticed a dull pain that comes and goes from that side of my breast, I waited until a week after my period had stopped but the pain is still coming and going, sometimes under arm pain too and down the side, shoulder blade and the breast all on the same side. I went back to the doctor who said lymphanodes can go up and down and to come back if it got any worse. I am extremely anxious about health in general and am currently walking around nearly in tears that something is wrong. Do i push for more testing? Or take reassurance from the ultrasound that was only 4 weeks ago? I have read ultrasounds are quite accurate on spotting anything suspicious so trying my best to take comfort in that? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Should I still be worried?? Please help! Vicky9989 Vicky9989

Posts.Content: Sep 4, 2017 06:18AM Vicky9989 wrote: Hello again, just returning to say the pain hasn't died down 4 weeks on :(! went back to the doctors 3 times in that time to only be told lymphanodes do that and to take ibuprofen. Well the third time, I broke down in tears and said I'm not reassured, and the doctor has now referred me again to the breast clinic so am currently waiting for my appointment. The pain Is by no mean intense, doesn't wake me up when I'm sleeping etc... but it just feels like something's there in the same area as the 'lymphanode' like a pinching and is tender when pushed. I am worried sick and am finding it hard to carry on with day to day life. What testing do I need to insist on? A biopsy of the lymphanode? 3D mammogram or MRI? If they only do an ultrasound again should I take comfort in that? I really need to know what to push for before I go. All this is really effecting my mental wellbeing and I'm struggling ðŸ˜¢ Xxx
